00032 #include "egs_conez.h"
00033 #include "egs_input.h"
00034 
00035 string XProjector::type = "EGS_Xconez";
00036 string YProjector::type = "EGS_Yconez";
00037 string ZProjector::type = "EGS_Zconez";
00038 string Projector::type = "EGS_conez";
00039 
00040 extern "C" {
00041 
00042     EGS_CONEZ_EXPORT EGS_BaseGeometry *createGeometry(EGS_Input *input) {
00043 
00044         // valid input
00045         if (!input) {
00046             egsWarning("createGeometry(conez): null input?\n");
00047             return 0;
00048         }
00049         string type;
00050         int err = input ->getInput("type",type);
00051         if (err) {
00052             egsWarning("createGeometry(conez): missing type key\n");
00053             return 0;
00054         }
00055 
00056         // apex
00057         EGS_Vector xo;
00058         vector<EGS_Float> tmp;
00059         err = input->getInput("apex",tmp);
00060         if (!err && tmp.size() == 3) {
00061             xo=EGS_Vector(tmp[0],tmp[1],tmp[2]);
00062         }
00063         else {
00064             egsWarning("createGeometry(conez): invalid apex\n");
00065             return 0;
00066         }
00067 
00068         // opening angles
00069         vector<EGS_Float> angles;
00070         err = input->getInput("opening angles",angles);
00071         bool is_radian = false;
00072         if (err) {
00073             angles.clear();
00074             err = input->getInput("opening angles in radian",angles);
00075             if (err) {
00076                 egsWarning("createGeometry(conez): no 'opening angles' or "
00077                            "'opening angles in radian' input\n");
00078                 return 0;
00079             }
00080             is_radian = true;
00081         }
00082 
00083         // check valid angles
00084         int nc = angles.size();
00085         for (int j=0; j<nc; j++) {
00086             if (angles[j] <= 0) {
00087                 egsWarning("createGeometry(conez): opening angles must be"
00088                            " positive\n");
00089                 return 0;
00090             }
00091             if (angles[j] >= 90) {
00092                 egsWarning("createGeometry(conez): opening angles should be "
00093                            "less than 90\n");
00094                 return 0;
00095             }
00096             if (j > 0) {
00097                 if (angles[j] <= angles[j-1]) {
00098                     egsWarning("createGeometry(conez): opening angles must be"
00099                                " in increasing order\n");
00100                     return 0;
00101                 }
00102             }
00103         }
00104         EGS_Float *t=new EGS_Float [angles.size()];
00105         for (int i=0; i<nc; i++) {
00106             t[i]=angles[i]*M_PI/180;
00107         }
00108 
00109         // select geometry
00110         EGS_BaseGeometry *g;
00111         if (type == "EGS_Xconez") {
00112             g = new EGS_ConezX(nc,t,xo,"",XProjector());
00113         }
00114         else if (type == "EGS_Yconez") {
00115             g = new EGS_ConezY(nc,t,xo,"",YProjector());
00116         }
00117         else if (type == "EGS_Yconez") {
00118             g = new EGS_ConezZ(nc,t,xo,"",ZProjector());
00119         }
00120         else {
00121             vector<EGS_Float> a;
00122             err=input->getInput("axis",a);
00123             if (err || a.size() !=3) {
00124                 egsWarning("createGeometry(conez): missing/wrong input\n");
00125                 return 0;
00126             }
00127             egsWarning("got axis (%g,%g,%g)\n",a[0],a[1],a[2]);
00128 
00129             g = new EGS_Conez(nc,t,xo,"",
00130                               Projector(EGS_Vector(a[0],a[1],a[2])));
00131         }
00132 
00133         g->setName(input);
00134         g->setMedia(input);
00135         return g;
00136     }
00137 }
